Subject: Heritrix JMX port - more than one opened port is needed?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=343342970

Hello,

I recently installed a firewall (just via iptables) on my remote box
running the crawler. I opened port 8849 (for JMX) on the remote
machine, but if I try to connect via a local web GUI, the connection
is always refused.

By running netstat -altp I've seen that Heritrix opens 3 ports: 8849
(JMX), and two others that change everytime I launch Heritrix. If I
open one of these two ports (in addition to 8849), then I can connect
correctly...

So my question is:

* Why does Heritrix use 3 ports? Why does it need those?
* How could I configure my firewall to access the remote crawl engine
correctly since the additional ports change at every reload?

Anyone can help with this?

Jean-Noel
